II. The House of the Asmoneans, and the Xystus, or open yallery. King Agrippag calls the people of Jerusalem together into the Xystus, and sets his sister Berenice in their view, ἐπὶ τῆς Ἀσαμωναίων οἰκίας, &c., ‘⁶ upon the House of the Asmoneans, which was above the Xystus, in the farther part of the Upper Gity.'’
